resolve-cwd

Resolve the path of a module like require.resolve() but from the current working directory

Install

$ npm install --save resolve-cwd

Usage

```js const resolveCwd = require(‘resolve-cwd’);

console.log(__dirname); //=> ‘/Users/sindresorhus/rainbow’

console.log(process.cwd()); //=> ‘/Users/sindresorhus/unicorn’

resolveCwd(‘./foo’); //=> ‘/Users/sindresorhus/unicorn/foo.js’ ```

API

resolveCwd(moduleId)

Like require(), throws when the module can’t be found.

resolveCwd.silent(moduleId)

Returns null instead of throwing when the module can’t be found.

moduleId

Type: string

What you would use in require().
